Here’s what I found about ZA Bank (Hong Kong virtual bank) opening account rules, especially re: non-HKID holders / travellers, plus how that compares to if you have HKID or are a traveller with travel permit.

ZA Bank: What official sources say

From ZA Bank’s website / blog:

  • They allow visiting tourists/travellers to open an account, under certain conditions. ([blog.za.group][1])

  • Requirements as a visitor (“訪港旅客”) include:

    1. A valid mainland China ID card (Mainland Resident Identity Card) in addition to the Travel Permit (往來港澳通行證) with at least 30 days remaining from the date of account opening; the permit’s endorsement/stamp must still be valid on the day of opening. ([blog.za.group][1])
    2. Be physically in Hong Kong at the time of application. ([blog.za.group][1])
    3. A mainland mobile phone number that can receive local (Hong Kong) SMS/phone calls. ([blog.za.group][1])
    4. A mainland bank savings card, and that the phone number tied to that card is the same number you supply in the ZA Bank application. ([blog.za.group][1])

  • They also explicitly say you must be 18 or older. ([blog.za.group][2])

  • The opening process is fully via the ZA Bank app; you scan your identity documents, do face verification, fill in address / phone / employment etc. ([blog.za.group][2])

Key constraints / “must-have” for travellers / non-HKID

Putting the above together, if you’re a Chinese citizen with a Travel Permit, these are minimum requirements for ZA Bank in Hong Kong (as of latest info):

Requirement Are you likely to satisfy?
Valid Travel Permit (往來港澳通行證), valid for ≥ 30 days from application date, with valid endorsement on the day Yes, if your permit is in order
Valid Mainland Resident Identity Card Yes, since you mention being a Chinese citizen with travel permit
Be physically in Hong Kong while applying You must physically be in Hong Kong when doing the ZA Bank app’s opening flow. ([blog.za.group][1])
Mainland mobile number (able to receive HK SMS/calls) Yes, must have a phone you can use locally (or at least receive Hong Kong SMS) ([blog.za.group][1])
Mainland bank savings card linked to that phone number Required, as part of identity / financial verification. ([blog.za.group][1])

Things that ZA Bank probably does not allow (or are unclear / more difficult)

  • If you do not hold HKID (which seems to be your case), some of the identity verification features (like scanning HKID or e-KYC for HKID holders) are not applicable. ZA Bank has separate workflows for HKID holders vs visitors. ([blog.za.group][1])
  • If your Travel Permit or endorsement is invalid / about to expire <30 days, likely rejected.
  • If your phone number or bank savings card is not from mainland / not matching, that might cause trouble.
  • Proof of local Hong Kong address might be relevant for some services, but for just opening a ZA Bank account as a visitor they don’t require a Hong Kong address according to their description. ([blog.za.group][1])

Summary: Can you open ZA Bank with a Travel Permit?

Yes — but only if you meet ZA Bank’s “visiting travellers” criteria. Based on your description (“Chinese citizen with Travel Permit”), here is what you’d need to check/ensure:

  1. Your Travel Permit is valid ≥ 30 days from the date you apply, and the endorsement (the entry permission part) is still valid that day.
  2. You also have a valid Mainland Resident ID.
  3. You are physically in Hong Kong when opening the account.
  4. You have a mainland mobile phone number (that can receive HK-local SMS) and a mainland bank savings card linked to that number.
  5. Be ≥18 years old.

If all those are satisfied, you should be able to use the ZA Bank app to open the account (app‐based, eKYC, etc).
